newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia tax reform still on agenda - Costello.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia tax reform still on agenda - Costello.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said that taxation reform was not off the agenda, but that at the moment the government was concentrating on other areas.

"I think there is an area of tax reform, particularly in relation to complexity, and busines compliance and fringe benefits tax, that we want to really progress in the next year," Costello said in answer to a question at the National Press Club.

"Let's just take budgets one at a time. This is a budget whcih addressses the most pressing task, and if we can secure this budget through the Senate then we can turn around and start addressing our next priorities," Costello said.
"This is going to be an ongiong reform programme," he said.
The government announced savings of A$7.2 billion, starting with A$3.9 billion in 1996/97, in its 1996/97 budget released on Tuesday.
